infotexts.mlc.beaconconsttooltip: Construction has halted on a ‖color:gui.orange‖beacon station‖end‖ in this passageway pending a delivery of [requestedsupplies]. Once constructed, it will make it easier for human habitation to spread into nearby locations.
infotexts.mlc.distresstooltip: Someone has activated a distress beacon in this passage. A lost crew, free salvage or something else?
infotexts.mlc.distresstooltipfaint: The signal from the distress beacon in this passage is growing weak. Whatever is here isn't going to be detectable much longer.
infotexts.mlc.pirateactivitytooltip: There have been reports of pirate activity near this area. Crews should exercise caution.
infotexts.mlc.distress.new: A new distress beacon has been picked up between [location1] and [location2]
infotexts.mlc.distress.faint: The signal from the distress beacon between [location1] and [location2] is growing faint.
infotexts.mlc.distress.lost: The distress signal between [location1] and [location2] can no longer be detected over background noise.
infotexts.entitydescription.distressbeacon: Produces a long range signal that can be detected by a sonar monitor, handheld sonar, or navigation terminal.
infotexts.entitydescription.jumpstarter: Battery powered electrical device used to jump start dead systems.
infotexts.entitydescription.captains_notebook: A small, wellworn paper book. Typically used by sub captains to record their travels. Can be sold for a high price at stations or read to garner some experience.
infotexts.entitydescription.mlc_beaconutilitysuppl: A box of various utility supplies for use in constructing beacons. Degrades when in water. Store on a shelf for safe keeping.
infotexts.entitydescription.mlc_beaconstructuralsu: A box of various structural supplies for use in constructing beacons. May cause injury when sliding. Store on a shelf for safe keeping.
infotexts.entitydescription.mlc_beaconelectrialsup: A box of various electrical supplies for use in constructing beacons. Degrades when in water. Store on a shelf for safe keeping.
infotexts.entitydescription.mlc_beaconsmat1: Heavy plating used to make the exterior of beacon stations. Built to resist the crushing pressure as well as various wildlife.
infotexts.entitydescription.mlc_beaconsmat2: Lightweight metal sheets used to line the interior of beacon stations.
infotexts.entitydescription.mlc_beaconsmat3: Heavy duty trusses and anchors used to secure a beacon station to the walls of a cavern.
infotexts.entitydescription.mlc_beaconemat1: Assorted circuits used in the construction of beacon sonar systems. Will break if exposed to water.
infotexts.entitydescription.mlc_beaconemat2: Large and small cabling used to supply power and connect circuitry on beacon stations. Will break if exposed to water.
infotexts.entitydescription.mlc_beaconemat3: Various fuses, switches and breakers used in a beacon stations electrical system. Will break if exposed to water.
infotexts.entitydescription.mlc_beaconumat1: Pipes, valves and other flow control systems used to keep water out and air inside a beacon station.
infotexts.entitydescription.mlc_beaconumat2: Shielding, control rods and steam exchange systems used in the construction of a beacon stations reactor. Will break if exposed to water.
infotexts.entitydescription.mlc_beaconumat3: Welding flux, rubber patches and other products used to seal gaps in a beacon station.
infotexts.mlc.server.wrongversionclient: Your client is using the wrong version!\nClient: v[clientversion] Server: v[serverversion]
infotexts.mlc.server.wrongversion: Client [client] is using the wrong version!\nClient: v[clientversion] Server: v[serverversion]
infotexts.mlc.server.installed: Client [client] has More Level Content installed correctly!
infotexts.mlc.patchnote: More Level Content Patch Notes v[version]
infotexts.mlc.settings.moveruinstooltip: The chance for alien ruins to spawn in the abyss area
infotexts.mlc.settings.maxdistresscounttooltip: How many distress beacons can be active at the same time
infotexts.mlc.settings.spawndistresschancetooltip: Percentage chance for a new distress beacon to spawn
infotexts.mlc.config.piratespawnchancetooltip: Increasing this value above 0 will result in a LOT more pirate outposts spawning, potentially upsetting the game balance.
infotexts.mlc.config.piratehuskchancetooltip: The chance for pirate outposts to spawn with everyone on board husked. Default is 1.
infotexts.mlc.config.piratediffnoise: Difficulty Noise, this value affects how much noise is added to the difficulty. For example a value of 25 can result in pirates 25% harder than the current difficulty spawning.
infotexts.mlc.config.piratedisplaysonartooltip: If a marker for the pirate base should appear on sonar.
infotexts.mlc.config.piratescaledifftooltip: If the difficulty of the pirates should scale with server members.
infotexts.mlc.config.debugverbosetooltip: Enable verbose logging, provides detailed (but longer) logs
infotexts.mlc.config.debuginternaltooltip: Enable internal logging, which logs internal debugging messages to console
infotexts.mlc.hint.jumpstarter: A ‖color:gui.orange‖Jump Starter‖end‖ can be used to temporarily power dead electrical devices, such as shuttle batteries. They can be crafted or bought at outposts.
infotexts.mlc.title: More Level Content
infotexts.distress.new0: Listening stations have detected a ‖color:gui.Red‖distress beacon‖end‖ between [location1] and [location2]
infotexts.distress.new1: A ‖color:gui.Red‖distress beacon‖end‖ has been reported between [location1] and [location2]
infotexts.distress.new2: [location1] has reported a new ‖color:gui.Red‖distress beacon‖end‖ in the caves leading to [location2]
infotexts.distress.faint0: Listening stations report the ‖color:gui.Red‖distress beacon‖end‖ between [location1] and [location2] is growing faint
infotexts.distress.faint1: Projected ice movement will soon leave the ‖color:gui.Red‖distress beacon‖end‖ between [location1] and [location2] unaccessable
infotexts.distress.lost0: The ‖color:gui.Red‖distress beacon‖end‖ between [location1] and [location2] can no longer be detected
infotexts.distress.lost1: Ice drift has rendered the ‖color:gui.Red‖distress beacon‖end‖ between [location1] and [location2] inaccessible
infotexts.distress.lost2: A submarine crew passing through [location1] to [location2] report there were no survivors at the ‖color:gui.Red‖distress beacon‖end‖
infotexts.mlc.lostcargonew0: Lost cargo has been reported between [location1] and [location2].
infotexts.mlc.lostcargotooltip: A freighter submarine has ditched some of it's cargo due to 'complications' in this passage.
infotexts.mlc.lostcargo.tooslow0: The lost cargo between [location1] and [location2] has been claimed by another crew.
infotexts.mlc.lostcargo.tooslow1: Long range listening stations can no longer detect the lost cargo between [location1] and [location2].
infotexts.mlc.lostcargo.tooslow2: Based on projected currents and ice movement, the lost cargo between [location1] and [location2] is no longer recoverable.
infotexts.mlc.relaystationtooltip.inactive: An old ‖color:gui.Orange‖relay station‖end‖ in this passage has stopped transmitting signals. Bringing it back online will help local communication.
infotexts.mlc.relaystationtooltip.active: There's an active ‖color:gui.Orange‖relay station‖end‖ in this passage.
infotexts.relayrepair.terminal:
KELETCO RELAY v[version]
Station [station]
------------------------

Calibration Table
IN | OPERATION 1 - OPERATION 2 - OPERATION 3 | OUT
IN [input0] | [step10] - [step20] - [step30] | OUT [output0]
IN [input1] | [step11] - [step21] - [step31] | OUT [output1]
IN [input2] | [step12] - [step22] - [step32] | OUT [output2]
infotexts.mlc.config.pirate.peakspawnchance.toolti: The peak percentage chance for a pirate base to be generated. Bases are most common at 50% level difficulty. For instance if this is set to 100%, if the level difficulty is exactly 50% a pirate base will be guaranteed to be generated.
infotexts.piratebase.active: There's an active pirate base in this passage, be careful!
infotexts.piratebase.husked: The unlucky pirates in this passage have been turned into husks.
infotexts.piratebase.destroyed: The pirate base in this passage has been destroyed.
infotexts.entitydescription.sonarjammer: Produces powerful, high amplitude frequences that disrupt sonar.
infotexts.entitydescription.sonarguide: A device that produces sonar pings detectable over long distances, used to guide passing submarines to points of interest.
infotexts.mapfeature.autotrader_weapons: There's an automatic weapons trader in this passage.
infotexts.mapfeature.autotrader_supplies: There's an automatic supplies trader in this passage.
infotexts.mapfeature.waystation: There's a waystation in this passage.
infotexts.mapfeature.clownstation: There's a clown theatre in this passage.
infotexts.mapfeature.abyssresearch: There's an abyssal research facility somewhere under this passage.
infotexts.mapfeature.huskchurch: There's a husk church in this passage.
infotexts.mapfeature.huskchurch.name: Husk Church
infotexts.mapfeature.autotrader_weapons.name: Automatic Weapons Trader
infotexts.mapfeature.autotrader_supplies.name: Automatic Supplies Trader
infotexts.mapfeature.waystation.name: Waystation
infotexts.mapfeature.clownstation.name: Clown Theatre
infotexts.mapfeature.abyssresearch.name: Abyssal Research Facility
infotexts.mapfeature.revealed.description: Check the campaign map for more information.
infotexts.entitydescription.mailman_researchdata: Some kind of important research data pertaining to the abyssal depths of Europa. You can't make much sense of it.
infotexts.entitydescription.abyssresearch_alienobj: An alien object of unknown function. It seems to have transported the researchers here. You could probably sell this for a lot to the right people.
infotexts.mlc.gamemodewarning.description: More Level Content does not support multiplayer gamemodes other than campaign! Using it in other gamemodes will cause issues and may even crash your game.
